subject: Mathematics
subs: solve practical problems that involve perimeter, area, and volume in standard units of measure; and
differentiate among perimeter, area, and volume and identify whether the application of the concept of perimeter, area, or volume is appropriate for a given situation.

subject: Mathematics
subs: given the equivalent measure of one unit, identify equivalent measurements within the metric system; and
solve practical problems involving length, mass, and liquid volume using metric units.

text: The student will identify and describe the diameter, radius, chord, and circumference of a circle.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will solve practical problems related to elapsed time in hours and minutes within a 24-hour period.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will classify and measure right, acute, obtuse, and straight angles.
subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
subs: classify triangles as right, acute, or obtuse and equilateral, scalene, or isosceles; and
investigate the sum of the interior angles in a triangle and determine an unknown angle measure.

subject: Mathematics
subs: recognize and apply transformations, such as translation, reflection, and rotation; and
investigate and describe the results of combining and subdividing polygons.
